result.execSummary:
Angela S Carlson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Angela S Carlson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No updated address information - unable to forward.  (5/10/17 /hb )
Case was scheduled for review hearing today re: extradition status. Clerk called jail and they indicated that Ms. Carlson was no longer in their custody.
NOH for the def sent to LKA//def in custody

Defendant's Notice of Hearing for the 9/18/14 Hearing

Mailed to: 4419 11th Ave. Apt. 239 Rockford, IL 61109
Returned by USPS: Return to Sender/ Not deliverable as addressed / Unable to Forward
Review hearing on October 21, 2014 at 01:45 pm.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 10:13am.
Defendant Angela S Carlson in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews Extradition rights with Ms. Carlson. 
Ms. Carlson waives her extradition rights, signing the Waiver of Extradition and Hearing document.  

After of Attorney Svehlek requests that the hearing on Ms. Carlson's Jefferson County traffic citation be rescheduled to a date soon, so that Ms. Carlson can address the traffic case before being transported, the Traffic Hearing date/time in the subject case, #14TR5817, is rescheduled from October 14th to next Tuesday, September 23rd at 9:00am.
recess 10:16am. 

NEXT:  (1) reschedule Case #14TR5817 from 10/14/14 to 9/23/14 at 9:00am.  (2) schedule Case #14CF305 for Review Hearing (to ensure that the Kentucky authorities have come to transport Ms. Carlson) in thirty days
Def. NOH for the 9/29/14 Extradition Hearing; Return to Sender, Not Deliverable as Addressed; Unable to Forward - Notice also sent to JESO & SPD
Extradition hearing on September 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 1:16pm.
Defendant Angela S Carlson appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ms. Carlson indicates that the date of birth and the address listed on the Extradition Complaint are correct; she indicates that Apartment 239 is part of the address. 
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Extradition Complaint admitted, reading waived.
Attorney Svehlek indicates that Ms. Carlson is challenging the Extradition Complaint. 
Based on the Court's review of the appended warrant, the Court finds probable cause that the person appearing before the Court is the same person being sought for the felony charge in the State of Kentucky. The Court commits Ms. Carlson for up to thirty days. 

The Court requires a $5,000  cash bond, with conditions:
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
recess 1:36pm. 

NEXT: Extradition Hearing in Branch I on 9/29/14 at 10:30am
